intro: Crepis oporinoides, commonly known as the slender mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in grasslands and meadows. The plant features basal rosettes of silver-gray, hairy leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
